build.lib.data package

Submodules

build.lib.data.Dataset module

class Dataset(data, column_names=None, data_time_info=None, target_info=None, encode_categorical=True, remove_constants=True, remove_missing=False, unique_val_thr=5)[source]

Bases: object

A class for efficiently managing datasets. It supports loading data from pandas DataFrames, numpy arrays, CSV files, and more, with flexible handling of column names and robust error management.

load_data(data, column_names=None)[source]

Loads data into the Dataset instance, handling different types of input data with flexibility for missing column names.

Parameters: - data: The data to load (DataFrame, numpy array, or CSV file path). - column_names: Optional column names for numpy array or CSV file without headers.

process_data(encode_categorical=True, remove_constants=True, remove_missing=False, unique_val_thr=5)[source]

Processes the loaded data, performing type detection, optional encoding of categorical variables, and removing constant columns or rows with missing values based on user preference.

Parameters: - encode_categorical: Whether to encode categorical variables. - remove_constants: Whether to remove constant columns. - remove_missing: Whether to remove rows with missing values. - unique_val_thr: Threshold for unique values count to consider a variable as categorical.

get_dataset()[source]

Returns the loaded and processed dataset.

get_info()[source]

Returns a summary of the dataset information, including data types and time-related information if available.

build.lib.data.utils module

var_types_and_categorical_encoding(data, encode_categorical=True, remove_constants=True, remove_missing=False, unique_val_thr=5)[source]

Analyzes and optionally transforms the data based on the variable types, presence of constant columns, and missing values.

Parameters:

  • data – pandas DataFrame with possible nan values, str, int, floats, and objects.

  • encode_categorical – boolean indicating whether to encode categorical variables.

  • remove_constants – boolean indicating whether to remove constant columns.

  • remove_missing – boolean indicating whether to remove rows with any missing values.

  • unique_val_thr – threshold to determine if a variable is categorical based on its unique values count.

Returns:

possibly transformed DataFrame based on the options. data_type_info: DataFrame with variable type information and additional details. data_type: overall data type classification (‘continuous’, ‘categorical’, ‘mixed’).

Return type:

data

timeseries_to_timelagged(data_pd, n_lags, window=False)[source]

Converts time-series data to time-lagged data Parameters ———-

data_pd (pandas dataframe): time-series dataset

e.g. V1, V2

n_lags(int) : number fo previous lags window(bool) : True for non-overlapped windows

data_pd_tl(pandas dataframe)time-lagged dataset

e.g. V1, V2, V1:1, V2:1

e.g. V1, V2, V1:1, V2:1

n_lags(int) : number fo previous lags
